intro: Dysosma furfuracea, commonly known as the hairy dysosma, is a perennial climbing plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by bright red berries. Dysosma furfuracea is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
